turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about MidwayUSA.
turn.2: The Volker-McClure act was passed in 1986, modifying the 1968 Gun Control Act to allow the sale of cartridge cases directly to the end consumer and MidwayUSA immediately changed their model from business to FFL, to also include business to consumer.
turn.3: What happened after they changed their model?
turn.4: In 1987 the business began adding other reloading products, the first of which was Lee Precision.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Computerization played a major role in the development of MidwayUSA; Potterfield had one computer class in college, and in 1982 he purchased the Company's first computer, an Apple III.
turn.7: What did he do after that?
turn.8: In 1986 he bought the first IBM; in March 1987 they began networking their computers together.
turn.9: What happened after they networked the computers?
turn.10: All of this is the basis for the very significant Information System and Website Management Departments at MidwayUSA today.
turn.11: Did they do anything after that?
turn.12: In 2014 MidwayUSA became an online only retailer moving away from mail orders and the master catalog upon which the company was built.
